sen.j: 北政所（きたのまんどころ）とは、天皇の宣旨により摂政や関白の正室に対して贈られた称号。
sen.e: Kitano mandokoro is the title given, through an emperor's proclamation, to the legally wedded wife of the person in the position of Sessho (Emperor's regent) or Kanpaku (the top advisor to the Emperor).

sen.j: 平安時代の寝殿造の邸宅では、半ば公の場所でもあった正殿の「寝殿」（しんでん）とは別に、その北に「北対」（きたのたい）という私的な居住空間があり、そこでは主の正室である「北の方」が家政の諸事万端を決裁していた。
sen.e: In a Shinden style residence in the Heian period, a private living quarter called "Kitanotai" was built in the north of and separated from "Shinden," which was the main hall and was used semi-publicly, and in that quarter, its master called "Kitanokata" who was the legally wedded wife controlled all of the houshold affairs.
